question: Which among the following is the lowest officer rank in the Indian Navy?
explanation: Sub Lieutenant is the lowest officer rank in the Indian Navy.Â  The Highest rank in Indian Navy is Admiral of the Fleet, which is like Field Marshal in Indian Navy, is a wartime or ceremonial rank. No officer of Indian Navy has been so far awarded this rank. The second highest rank is of Admiral, which is the Chief of the Naval Staff. The other officers include Vice Admiral, Rear Admiral, Commodore, Captain, Commander, Lt. Commander, Lieutenant and Sub-lieutenant. Further, there are Junior Commissioned Officers and Non-Commissioned Officers in the Indian Navy.
